10/10
I still vividly remember that midsummer of 2009, when the sky was so azure and clear, and the sunlight so bright and dazzling. Back then, carefree and still young, I wore a cool short-sleeved shirt, sitting intently before my computer screen, listening to a magical sunflower sing ‚ÄúThere's a zombie on your lawn.‚Äù Time seemed to move so slowly back then, each day simple and carefree. Sixteen years later, it suddenly dawned on me: I wasn't just playing a game all along‚ÄîI was constantly looking back at those irretrievable, youthful days.
Objectively a perfectly executed gem of a game. Infinite charm, zero fat, just pure tower defense fun.

[h2] Plants Vs Zombies really is something special [/h2] 
I have played this game ever since i was a little child, so it holds a lot of nostalgic value to me. I consider this one of my favourite comfort games

The aspects that make this game so great are well known, but i'm still gonna go through it real quick:
-The gameplay is simple, yet satisfying and infinitely replayable (even if the stages can feel slow at some points)
-The art is so cute.
-The music is so so good and iconic (especially [spoiler] "Zombie on your Lawn") [/spoiler]
-The comedy is so charming
-The plants and zombies are so varied and have really cute designs.

This game is a timeless classic for a reason. No matter how hard future installments might fumble, they will never take away from the sheer quality of the first game. Despite how "not good" of a remake Replanted was, i have to thank it for bringing my attention back to the original, so that i could experience this game again. 

I would also like to thank the developers and give them the spotlight that Replanted didn't give: 
-Thank you, George Fan, for directing this masterpiece
- Thank you, Tod Semple, for your programming that made this game possible
- Thank you, Rich Werner, for your wonderful art
- Thank you, Enrique Corts, for the beautiful backgrounds
- Thank you, Laura Shigihara, for the amazing and iconic music and sound effects
- Thank you, Matt Holmberg, for the consistent UI
- and Thank you, Stephen Notley, for all the charming text

[h3] Thank you all so much for your wonderful work. I will no doubt replay this game many times in the future. [/h3]
So yeah. You should totally play this game

Plants vs. Zombies: Get To The Garden! (Full Tactical Debrief)

Listen to me now! I have seen a lot of action, I have crushed many enemies, I have saved the future, but I never thought the greatest battle for Earth's survival would be fought with a lawnmower and a big sunflower! This is not some kindergarten garden club! This is total strategic warfare against the decaying forces of the undead, and you are the only hope for the brain!

You need to know something: this game is FANTASTIC! It is simple, it is deep, and it has enough action to make Rambo look like a waiter! It requires strength, intelligence, and the will to survive. You must be relentless!

Phase I: The Arsenal‚ÄîMore Than Just Vegetables

Your enemies, they are relentless, they are slow, but they are stupid! You must build your defense, and your plants? They are not plants, they are WEAPONS OF MASS DESTRUCTION! Every single seed packet is a bullet, a bomb, or a brick wall. Choose wisely!

The Economic Engine (The Sun Power!)

The Sunflower (The PUMP!): You need the sun, GO GET IT! This little guy is the engine of your economy. Without the sun, you are finished. You must plant him first, and you must plant him deep behind the lines! He is the fuel for the fight! Double up, triple up! Maximize sun production, or the war will be lost before it starts.

The Twin Sunflower: This is the upgrade! Two suns for the price of one tile! When your economy is established, you transition to these high-output generators. Efficiency is key to victory!

The Line of Fire (Attack Specialists)

The Peashooter (The Basic Cannon): He is the grunt! The soldier! He shoots straight and hard. Get to work, you sissy! You need him in every lane! A good foundation is built on peashooters!

The Split Pea: Double the trouble! Two barrels of justice! One pea forward, and a massive shot backward for those sneaky Digger Zombies. He is your anti-infiltration specialist!

The Repeater: Two peas in rapid succession! When the battle turns intense, you upgrade your peashooter to this weapon of continuous fire. Maximum devastation!

The Snow Pea (The FREEZE-GUN!): Not only does it hit, it slows them down. This is crucial tactical support. It keeps the zombie mass controllable. You slow them down, you control the pace of the battle!

The Close-Quarters Combat & Traps

The Wall-Nut (The IMPENETRABLE SHIELD): Look at this big, dumb brute! He stands there and he takes the punishment! When the big zombies come, you put this Wall-Nut down and you say, "Hasta la vista, baby!" He buys you time. Time is the power! Replant him instantly when he cracks!

The Chomper (The Hungry Beast): He's greedy, he's hungry! One bite, and then he needs to recharge! Use him wisely, or you will be sorry! He eliminates a heavy target instantly, but he is defenseless afterward. Put him behind a Wall-Nut, always!

The Potato Mine (The EXPLOSIVE TRAP): The patience of a hunter! You plant him, you wait for him to arm. CLICK! Then BAM! Total destruction! It's like a Predator trap! Use these in the early game to save sun.

Phase II: The Roster of the Dead‚ÄîPuny and Predictable

The zombies, they come in waves. They think they are tough because one has a cone on his head, and one has a bucket. I say, PUNY defenses! They walk, they eat, they stumble. They need to be terminated.

Conehead and Buckethead: Simple infantry. They have armor, but armor is temporary! Focus fire, and they will crumble. The Buckethead is tough‚Äîyou need a Cherry Bomb or a Jalape√±o for him sometimes!

Pole Vaulter Zombie: He thinks he's a gymnast! He jumps over the first plant! This is deception! You need to hit him with two layers of defense! He jumps the Wall-Nut, but then he must face the Chomper!

Digger Zombie: He comes under the ground! This is a covert operation! No problem! Use the Magnet-shroom to rip off his gear, or use the Split Pea to shoot him in the back!

Zomboni (The Ice Machine): This is a serious tactical threat! He drives the Zamboni! He turns your grass into ice and then the plants slip and slide! You must stop him with the Jalape√±o or Spike Rock before he destroys the infrastructure and creates a skating rink for the undead!

Disco Zombie: The party is over! He brings his backup dancers. They think they can distract you with the hustle! You terminate the main guy quickly, the dancers are finished too! FOCUS YOUR FIRE!

Gargantuar (The BIG GUN!): The big, smashing monster with the tiny zombie pilot! He takes massive punishment. You hit him with the Cherry Bomb! You hit him with the Squash! When he smashes the Wall-Nut, you must rebuild, or he will enter the base! This is the ultimate test of your firepower!

Phase III: The Training Modes‚ÄîMastering the Terrain

You must know your environment. You cannot fight the same battle in the day and the night!

Adventure Mode: This is the long war! Day, Night, Pool, Fog, ROOFTOP! Each location demands a new strategy! Adapt and overcome, like the T-800! Day levels are easy, but Night levels demand the use of the Mushroom Brigade because they are cheap! The Pool requires Lily Pads! The Rooftop requires Flower Pots! You must adjust your thinking!

Mini-Games: Short, sharp training exercises! Heavy Weapon, Zombotany, Vasebreaker‚Äîthey change the rules! Keeps the mind sharp and the adrenaline pumping! Don't get comfortable!

Survival Mode: This is the ultimate test of strength! Wave after wave! Only the strongest survive. This is where you separate the man from the boy! You must build a permanent defense that can withstand the final massive wave. It requires perfect lane management and maximum sun production!

Phase IV: COMMANDO TACTICS (Strategy & Execution)

You need to think like a general, not a civilian!

Sun is Money: Spend your sun wisely, but spend it fast in the beginning. The faster you build your Sunflower economy, the faster you can deploy heavy weapons later. Invest early to dominate late.

Lane Integrity is Everything: You cannot let one zombie pass! Every plant must cover the lane it is in. Use two rows of attackers! The first line to slow them, the second line to destroy them!

Use the Right Tool: Don't use a Wall-Nut to stop a Digger Zombie! Don't use a Peashooter on a Zomboni! Use the Jalape√±o for the ice, the Magnet-shroom for the metal, and the Cherry Bomb for instant, localized termination!

Always Have a Backup Plan: Get a plan B, C, and D, because the zombies, they are coming for you from everywhere! When a Wall-Nut crumbles, you must have the sun ready to replace it. When a lane is overwhelmed, you must use your explosives immediately!

Final Verdict

Plants vs. Zombies is a masterpiece of strategy and destruction. It takes real planning, real timing, and real muscle to succeed. It makes you feel strong, it makes you feel smart, and it is highly addictive. It‚Äôs like a workout for your brain!

I give this game TWO THUMBS UP! Now stop reading, go back to your screen, and GET TO THE CHOPPA‚Äîthe fight is waiting!
ill tell you what. this game has a satisfying gameplay loop, and isnt AI upscaled to boot!

Perfection..

Fun Game. It has all the same bells and whistles as the Replanted edition, just without the janky visuals, audio, and gameplay held together by duct tape. It's honestly remarkable how a game from 2009 is an overall better experience than the so-called "remaster". Who knew you could have the same amount of fun for a fraction of the price? 

10/10. Save yourself 15 bucks for a game that actually works.

The developer wanted to create his own tower defense game where enemies could actually interact with the defending towers - but who could've imagined that would turn into corn shooting from behind a walnut on a suburban rooftop? And somehow, it works perfectly.

A simple yet surprisingly clever concept made Plants vs. Zombies a global hit for a reason. All you need to do is plant your defenses and stop waves of zombies from reaching your house. The variety of plants allows for endless combinations and strategies, keeping the gameplay fun and creative. PVZ redefined what a tower defense game could be.

+ Pros:
Great variety of plants and strategies.
High replay value thanks to mods.

- Cons:
Levels become repetitive towards the end..

For a game's adventure mode to technically last about 3 worlds and probably 4 hours (4 levels with 2 variations and one "final" level at the end.) I think this game's greatness comes from AFTER you beat the main game. Its very fun to understand NG+ so much more when the game's difficulty ramps up and now you have to figure out what plants to work with like your just chilling with Crazy Dave just killing zombies on a daily basis every time you boot up the game.

But I think the most important part of this game's legacy is what this game COULD have lead to, being a very simple but very deep casual game that just gets harder every time. With so much of the casual game market basically spread over so many platforms with shady micro transactions, PvZ is feels like a unique Battle Chess game with several complementary game modes and a future that we could have had with these kind of games going against the AAA market we have today.

Positives:
See Above.

Negatives:
This game being from 2009 can lead to crashing at times on modern systems. This isn't a fault the game has naturally, although I could remember this game crashing even back then. Also, without mod support, you aren't gonna be seeing this game in full screen as even with the 4:3 ratio it will look incredibly stretched so be aware of setting up mods to making it look nicer, although I got through the entire game windowed just fine.

This game is great, the graphics and story are charming, the music is amazing, and the gameplay is pretty fun (albeit a bit easy at times, but I'm not sure if that's because I've played the game a lot or because I grew up)
This variant of Plants vs Zombies is currently one of the best officially available versions of the game (some of the older console versions are a bit better, but they are naturally less accessible due to being locked on an old console). It lacks certain features from Replanted, but Replanted has a lot of bugs and visual issues not present in most other versions, so I'd only recommend it if you need something specific (such as Steam Deck optimization)

The music is super catchy, from the sunny intro tunes to the intense ‚Äúfinal wave‚Äù tracks, making every victory feel epic.

Plus, the game is packed with nostalgia, funny zombies, charming art, and quirky sounds that bring back memories for longtime fans. Even years later, it‚Äôs still fresh, humorous, and endlessly entertaining.

In short, Plants vs. Zombies: GOTY Edition is a timeless, fun-filled game you‚Äôll keep coming back to.

Plants vs Zombies: Game of the Year Edition is a fun and addictive game that is definitely worth playing. The simple strategy of defending your house with different plants keeps the gameplay interesting while still being easy to learn. The humour, bright colours, and creative designs make the game enjoyable for all ages. The extra modes and mini-games in the GOTY edition add even more value and give you more reasons to keep playing. Overall, I am very happy with this game and it is absolutely worth it.

Plants vs. Zombies is one of those games that somehow never gets old. You open it ‚Äújust to play one level,‚Äù and suddenly an hour is gone. The mix of strategy, humor, and simple gameplay just works perfectly.

Every plant actually feels useful, and every zombie has its own weird personality. The game keeps things fresh too‚Äîfirst the lawn, then the night levels, then the fog, the pool, the roof‚Ä¶ it never feels repetitive. And when Crazy Dave shows up with his pots and random shouting? That‚Äôs peak gaming right there.

The best part is how easy it is to get into. Anyone can play it, but it still makes you think, especially in the later stages. Plus, the soundtrack is insanely catchy and the art style still looks great today.

If you grew up with it, it‚Äôs pure nostalgia. If you‚Äôre playing it for the first time, it‚Äôs honestly still better than most modern mobile games.

Objectively best version of PvZ to play on PC. Do NOT waste your money on the remaster, as they did not hire or ask for help from the original artist, creating bad renders of the original art style. 

This edition is the only one worth getting, it hasn't been updated since its release date and it doesn't need it. 

The new remaster didn't even have the same sound track system and had to be updated due to fan pressure. 

So: best version of PvZ, stick to this copy, solid OST and art style. Game play is very repeatable.

negative.review:
Before saying anything, I should make clear that I definitely recommend this game over Replanted, its remaster. However, that being said...

There's really no reason to play this version of the game over a console version if you have access to it. Both the Xbox 360 and PS3 versions are superior in every way, featuring more content and much higher resolutions.

GOTY Edition on PC runs in a native 800x600 resolution with no way to change it, and the lovely artwork is butchered as a result. This port was crapped out in a poor state and quickly abandoned. This especially stinks because, in my experience, the game also likes to crash. Due to this, I actually removed the game from my account years ago, after having only purchased it on sale for a buck as a novelty.

If you have no other way to play PvZ, then I'd say go for it, but get it as cheap as you can - none of the money you pay will be given to the people who poured their passion into it. Instead, it'll go to one of the worst corporations in the business, EA, and new leadership at PopCap that frankly have no idea what made this game special and don't care. And make no mistake, PvZ is a wonderful game with a lot of charm. It offers many, many hours of playtime to those who desire it. This version just doesn't do it proper justice in my opinion.
I wish the game was easier, actualy fun and I also wish the mods for this game would actualy work

I understand why people love this game so much, but for me, this is mid asf. Mainly because in adventure mode, the pacing is so unimaginably slow that I damn near fall asleep. I think the minigames are pretty cool, but for adventure mode, that is very boring to me.

100%'ing this was a pain

update: 20 more hours in and PopCap took my balls.
bro its basically a flash game... why sell this i can play it online free üôÑ i can get it on my android for free üôÑ i feel riped off üôÑ
The game dose not run, just pirate it
cant put saplings in the sunflower
i hate fog. cant get past 4-4.
